website_summaries.verdict: A mini tripod with the right combination of sturdy build and good design.
pros: Offers good adjustment for the price
cons: Could tip when used with a heavy DSLR setup

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing. Received a faulty one.
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to try this tripod. Once I opened it, the quality was amazing. It wasn’t the cheap type. But I am however disappointed that I received a faulty one. The lock holding the socket isn’t holding it’s full strength so it could barely even hold up my camera without tilting down. My camera isn’t that heavy or big as well. I was really hoping to use it for my DSLR, but that looks like it isn’t happening.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie

customer_reviews.title: The Ballhead On the One I Received DId Not Work At All
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what an unlucky customer I must be. I bought this and was really looking forward to using it. The legs seemed pretty sturdy. The ballhead, however, wouldn't lock and it would not hold my camera in any position other than slumped over to one side. YouTube videos show this product holding much larger DSLRs with larger lenses very solidly. I just use a small DSLR (Nikon D5500) with just kit lenses. What a piece of junk this thing was. Super disappointed. Returned immediately. Good luck to you if you buy one!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Cochran

customer_reviews.title: This is version one. Go for this one. Don't bite the bait of the version 2
customer_reviews.text: This little gizmo is as good as its descendant - the version 2 is bad. Do yourself a favor, avoid the "extensible legs and other bells and whistles" version and get this one. It is just the right size to fit pretty much everywhere, just tight enough to hold pretty much anything, and is SOLID as opposed to the version 2 which rattles and flexes like a drunk dancer's skeleton and is about two inches longer when folded. Those two inches that always make the difference (in this case - in a bad way :-P )
customer_reviews.author: N.S.

customer_reviews.title: Less than spectacular quality.
customer_reviews.text: I also own the original Manfrotto Pixie. It is an incredibly versatile tripod and works well as a handle when folded. I have used it extensively at home and abroad. It even went with me through the Peruvian Andes to support my G85. The Pixie 2 is NOTHING like the original. The Pixie feels solid and rugged. The “2” feels cheap. The broader base and higher stance are the only redeeming qualities. I am keeping it until it breaks and then I will likely replace it with another original Pixie.
customer_reviews.author: John McQuay

customer_reviews.title: I cannot believe Manfrotto could produce such crap
customer_reviews.text: I have a number of other Manfrotto products and they're excellent, sturdy, and very affordable. However this piece of crap -- wow, I had to even look twice -- could not even believe Manfrotto would make such a poor quality product. First off, it's made of PLASTIC. Yes, you read that right. PLASTIC legs. PLASTIC ball holder. The whole thing flexes if you push down on the camera. Get a Manfrotto 709B. 100% metal, rock solid, lasts for ages. Do NOT buy it for $57 on Amazon though -- that seller is a ripoff. Get it for $37 on eBay.
customer_reviews.author: yuanzhoulv

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough for DSLR
customer_reviews.text: It's a great size for travel but the swivel head was not strong enough to hold up my camera. I have one of the lighter configurations also with the Sony a7rii and Tamron lens.
customer_reviews.author: E. WALLEY

customer_reviews.title: head tips over with slightest tilt
customer_reviews.text: It’s July 2018 and this batch coming out of the factory is total garbage. I own 3 of these previously and just bought another 3 as gift. And then I found out the clamping mechanism is completely loose, camera / phone / tablet everything would just tip over with the slightest tilt, not to mention the weight and feel is completely different from the ones i owned before. Manfrotto completely blew it, they went cheap and flush their quality down the toilet. As is now this thing is not worth more than $6. I hope they turn it around with their next round.
customer_reviews.author: TN

customer_reviews.title: “Damaged/Not for sale” label on product
customer_reviews.text: Can’t trust buying anything here these days, this is the second manfrotto product I have an issue with, the first one was a drone bag that had the serial numbers blacked out, now this product came with the sticker indicating it was not for sale, weird. I see atleast one other reviewer with the same issue
customer_reviews.author: amazon user

customer_reviews.title: Great to throw in the camera bag!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a lightning deal because I thought it looked like it would fit in a bag nicely, would for macro, and would also work for phone photos. Bingo, 3-for-3. It's small enough that you can find a spot in the bag where you don't even know it's there, and it often makes the difference between just a photo and a GREAT photo. And it holds my Nikon D5100 with an 85mm macro lens no problem. If you're even semi-serious about photography, you should have one of these in your bag, console or glove box; I can p retty much guarantee it will pay for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a lighter tripod for hiking/backpacking to use with my Sony Alpha. Super light but quite sturdy. Held my camera with 24-105 just fine and shots came out great even with a 15 knot wind blowing. The ballhead has plenty of tension/friction to hold the camera/lens combo no problem. Folds up nice, takes up little room in the pack.
customer_reviews.author: S. O'

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy falls apart
customer_reviews.text: After only a few months this item had not held up. The legs are loose to a point where it’s not easy to hold when the legs are closed because they’re flopping all over the place. No way to tighten either. Hex screws that’s are just in between a standard or metric that would tighten the legs but don’t. My guess is to force you to buy a new one. Not on your life and I wouldn’t recommend you buy a first one.
customer_reviews.author: Ava Devine

customer_reviews.title: Seemed to be better quality
customer_reviews.text: 2nd time I purchase product. First time was for me and the second for my dad, who liked mine. Within a few days of him using it, it developed some cracks on the swivel plastic portion near the button. Thankfully I was able to return it but it’s a shame because I really like mine. Concerned about durability now. Simple design and lightweight made it ideal for traveling and seemed to be well made and sturdy. Not sure why the cracks occurred
customer_reviews.author: mtywek

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed--sturdy, well made, stable, and diverse in its functionality. Folds up nicely to fit in a camera, day, or travel bag. The quick release allows for rapid repositioning. Not designed for studio stills, this is a run-n-gun mini-tripod perfect for all-in-one cameras. It will surely last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Kai Staats

customer_reviews.title: A great little buy for your bag.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with my Fuji XT3. I was concerned about the size and using it with bigger lenses but it holds well if I position the legs to support the lens properly. I use adapted Canon lens with this. The Canon 135mm f2L and the 16-35mm f4L. Those lenses are big compared to the camera and longer with the adapter, but this tripod holds it all well. Once it's set up it works and doesn't tilt or anything. The size of this tripod is also great, you'll never need to remove it from your bag to accommodate something else.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Cowan

customer_reviews.title: Ball and socket joint is frozen - poorly manufactured product
customer_reviews.text: The ball and socket joint is very poorly manufactured and needs to be heavily forced to move even slightly (yes, I was pressing the unlock tab). If you get it to budge, then there is smeared black plastic remnant around the joint as if it was damaged. The design is quite nice, but the quality control or decision that poor quality is ok ruins this product for me. Never took it out of my bag on the vacation, so it’s a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: BigWillyStyle

customer_reviews.title: The perfect mini Tripod
customer_reviews.text: I really like Manfroto products as they are extremely well designed and built. This mini tripod is no exception. The legs close to form a very comfortable handle for walking around while holding a smart phone attached to the tripod (I especially like the Polar Pro light chaser kit for mounting my iPhone to a tripod). The head of this tripod is easy to adjust when you press the red release button but very secure and stable once you let go. I don't think there is a better mini tripod on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Jon P.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a DSLR Cannon 70d with this tripod to vlog.. I was nervous that the camera would not be stable, but for the price I took a shot and ordered it.... I AM SO GLAD I DID. This little tripod is very well made and durable, your camera will not budge from the position you secure it in.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a step up from the ‘first gen’ pixi tripod if you have ever used that. I use this specifically for handheld vlogging. It’s very well balanced when placed on a flat surface and the adjustable legs give you a lot of flexibility on uneven surfaces. My only gripe is that there is no way to lock the legs to make it stand taller. It sits very low to the ground and if used on a table to film yourself you will have a very awkward angle. Also, I wish they would have incorporated the ballhead from the first pixi with the easy to push button.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Delain

customer_reviews.title: Great with my Canon 80D!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small tabletop tripod that I could use with my Canon 80D. I love this! it is very sturdy and I completely trust it with my camera. It is lightweight and easy to travel with. You can video with it by using it as a handle. I have even left it hanging on my camera while walking around taking pictures on vacation. It does not add much weight so it just hangs there but once I need to sit my camera down it is ready to go. The ball head is easy to use and works great. LOVE this Tripod!
customer_reviews.author: Actionaholic

customer_reviews.title: No vertical orientation possible
customer_reviews.text: This would be perfect for a minimalist easy to carry tripod for smaller cameras if it wasn't for one stupid design flaw. There is no slot in the socket of the ball and socket assembly to allow the tripod base to be tilted over for vertical (portrait) orientation. If you only take horizontal (landscape) shots and never tilt the camera 90 degrees for vertical compositions, great. If I knew of this flaw, I would not have bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Albert G. Smith Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Fragile and unstable
customer_reviews.text: Seems rugged because it’s so heavy, but I dropped mine and it shattered like glass. The weak point it where the legs swivel. Not the sturdiest design, I’ve bumped my camera and it’s gone spilling a few times, the design has made the surface area points of contact between tripod legs and table very small so they don’t grip the table well and hence make it very unstable. Seems like a nice finish. The ball head swivels nicely but don’t use a heavy camera it will easily tip over. Mine broke. Overall disappointed due to its instability and fragility
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Bell

customer_reviews.title: The proof that you can make a decent product at a fair price!!
customer_reviews.text: I seen where this product had a lot of 5 star reviews. I did not need it for a camera I needed for my Zoom H4N Recorder mounted the same as a camera would be. PERFECT!!! Right everything and even fits in the same bag which gives the functionality of a ready to use " Kit" Plus if I ever needed a unobtrusive stand I can see that it can easy hold my camera. The proof that you can make a decent product at a fair price!!
customer_reviews.author: Kenyatta Becktemba

customer_reviews.title: Legs would not stay locked
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this tripod to hold a Sony DSLR, but the legs would not stay locked and it slowly sunk to the desk. I tried all the adjustments to lock them, but the legs would not stay. I packed it right back up and returned it. I own and use other full-size Manfrotto tripods, but this Pixi-Evo 2 does not measure up to their normal high standards. Not sure if I just got a defective one, but I really wanted the features this tripod promised.
customer_reviews.author: Bookfan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this ! I’ve seen some other YouTubers using this and I wanted to check it out since I was preciously using the JOBY gorilla pod which was incredibly hard to keep steady since there’s many different joints. This mini tripod is something I’ve been looking for for a long time! It’s incredibly sturdy and holds my canon G7X well. It’s so sturdy that it’s sort of hard to move the joint to level it which is great (not sure why you’d wanna move it any other way other than level honestly). This is definitely worth the money! It holds super comfy in your hand as well.
customer_reviews.author: K. Vici

customer_reviews.title: Ballhead was loose from the start
customer_reviews.text: Ballhead was loose from the moment i unboxed it , and seems to have gotten worse , it moves very freely without pressing the button. but i know people who rave about it , and I just love the size and versatility , so I am ordering another one from a different seller , it's just not worth the trouble to try to send it back because of the cost, I took the legs off as suggested in other reviews and tried to tighten screws , but they were already tight. I am hoping the 2nd one i am ordering has a tighter ballhead
customer_reviews.author: Robbie V.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Build vs Off-Brand
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these, one Manfrotto brand and another that is off-brand. This one is far better. You push the adjustment button to change the direction of the ball head. The off-brand one has a screw that holds it in place, which does not feel as secure. The Manfrotto feels like a much better build, in quality and sturdiness. I recommend spending a few extra dollars and getting this one vs the generic ones.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Gattorna

customer_reviews.title: Not only for DSLR'S
customer_reviews.text: I am using this tripod for my bose revolve speaker and let me tell you how essential this has been for the quality of the speaker sound, revolve emmitt the sound in spherical way and mounting them in a tripod will eliminate the flat surface sound wave interference which lead to quality reduction in sound, this tripod is the magic solution, of course there are many other brand of mini tripod but I wouldn't trust my bose expensive speaker to any other than manfrotto.
customer_reviews.author: Al.

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy little tripod.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little tripod, quite sturdy for its size. This little guy is strong enough to easily suport my Canon T7i with either of my favorite prime lenses attached (Canon 24 2.8 and 50 1.8). It's a real handy tool if you want to shoot selfies (closed legs make a nice hand grip) or if you need a sturdy support on picnic tables, park benches, or in a pinch, the hood of your car. I also like to mount my Manfrotto Lumimuse 8 (LED lights) on this platform when I'm shooting indoor setups. This is a quality little tripod and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Davis

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Little Tripod
customer_reviews.text: First, let me say that I'm a big fan of Manfrotto Tripods. They make some of the best in the industry. In this case, this is just a little one, perfect for some travel photos, and those other times you need a small tripod just to hold the camera still. Wonderful purchase. You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Joe M.

customer_reviews.title: Decent but could be a lemon
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this tripod mainly for my phone. I didn’t want one of the popular joint legs, I just wanted something simple. When I first got the tripod it would barely hold my phone up. After removing the legs (see my pictures) I was able to tighten down the 4 screws that adjust the tension. Now it is pretty secure but I have to pull the release knob out because it won’t pop out on its own.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Decent handheld tripod
customer_reviews.text: Product works pretty well, but maybe a tinny bit too well. The "ball" is pretty difficult to move, even when pushing down the button to allow it to be adjusted. Takes a decent amount of force, but that would also allow it to hold something a little heavier. I'm only using a GoPro on mine, so it does take a bit of force to make it move. The button feels "off" build wise, just feels like it could break at any press.
customer_reviews.author: Bill W

customer_reviews.title: Best small tripod I own
customer_reviews.text: I have many many many tripods from small to large but this one is my go to. It's perfect for holding and filming or just setting it up. The ball head on it moves very easily to get that perfect shot. This tripod is my go to most of the time. I will probably buy a second one for my other camera.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Barber

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely, Awesome Tri-Pod! I am so happy with the quality and strength of this little marvel. I personally use it to hold a speed light in tight spaces and love it! It does hold my full size dslr with a 18-250mm lens with no problem as well. Easy to throw in my back pack for adventure outings. Holds very tight, never once slipped or tipped over. I honestly see more of these in my arsenal very soon.
customer_reviews.author: SkunkWorks

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, sturdy, reliable and solid table-top tripod.
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this product if you need a small, portable tripod for occasional use. The legs fold in to make a slim overall package that fits nicely in my camera bag. It's there when I need it and I forget about it when I don't, which is the ideal state of affairs for a tripod. I'm not sure how well this would handle a huge DSLR and Canon L type lenses, but for my 35mm and Micro 4/3rds cameras, even with the Olympus Pro zoom attached, the little thing held up great. At this price point I would buy again without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: Xymnslot

customer_reviews.title: Very stiff swivel but may just be the one i recieved...
customer_reviews.text: Just got this tripod out of the box and the swivel is so hard to move!! When i press the red button it bearly goes inward. I don't know if i just got a bad one, but i am dissapointed because i was so pumped for it reading all of these other amazing reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Aguilar Jr,

customer_reviews.title: So Light and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Brought this with me on my recent trip to Utah. On prior trips I wouldn’t take nearly as many long exposure shots as my tripod and camera bag setup aren’t the most convenient for long hikes. However, this thing easily fit into my bag and screwed on without any issues. What really surprised me is how it remained stable (when positioned correctly) even with my Sony GM 24-70 2.8 on my camera. Now I have photos I certainly wouldn’t have normaly took ths time to take.
customer_reviews.author: Average Shopper

customer_reviews.title: PIXI + Zoom H6: So Happy Together
customer_reviews.text: I referenced the Manfrotto MTPIXI in my review of the Zoom H6 Handy Recorder so it's only fair that I give it its own review. I first learned about this mini tripod when my wife got one as an accessory for her MEVO camera. I was immediately impressed by the build quality and function of the PIXI. This product is perfect with the H6 and I love the appearance of the pair when I set up my recording gear. There are less expensive options but for a premium device like the H6, the PIXI is the natural complement. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Perez

customer_reviews.title: Well Made - Using for Flashlight Stands
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made mini tripod, but I wouldn't put anything too heavy on it, or anything with a long lens. Instead, I am using two of these for 1" Flashlight Holders for use with Macro Photography. Also works for an iPhone holder. ~PhotosByMeta
customer_reviews.author: PhotosByMeta

customer_reviews.title: Near perfect for a quick and dirty light stand.
customer_reviews.text: I use these as quick and dirty speed light stands when I'm in a situation where setting up an actual light stand just isn't going to fly. Set discretely on a shelf or mantle even the occasional TV stand the ball head allows for infinite adjustment and although I've never used it for the purpose of holding a camera I did test it out with a D610 and an 85 1.4 and it was fine with it. Just screw on a transmitter or use a cold shoe and it's the perfect out of the way light source.
customer_reviews.author: D. HarmanTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Great for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this with my Sony a6000 and it's the perfect combination for backpacking. It fits nicely inalong with the. The tripod itself feels very solid and can balance the a6000 even with an 18-200mm lens. The ball mechanism is surprisingly smooth when adjusting then is rock solid when it's locked. No it's not the lightest mini tripod in the market but it's sturdy as anything.
customer_reviews.author: jonizzzle

customer_reviews.title: Really nice mini tripod
customer_reviews.text: Really nice design with the ball/button rather than a screw. The only reason I'm rating 4/5 is because the ball needed to be wiped off every time it was adjusted for the first day or so. A lot of small black specs would turn up as it was broken in. While it was hard to turn at first, it got easier and easier as I used it. This may be specific to the one I received and not all items. I'd certainly recommend this tripod, though.
customer_reviews.author: Justin K.

customer_reviews.title: Love This Thing
customer_reviews.text: Got this for some long exposure shots. Love the portability. And its so stable and durable. Fits my nikon D500 with no issues and also fits the Sony A7iii with no issues. Its very sturdy when you set it down. I use this mainly for street photography when I want to catch the streaks of cars passing by. Will def recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob L.

customer_reviews.title: Used Sony A7rii with Canon 70-200 f4 and it works :)
customer_reviews.text: Okay so it’s June and I’ve had this tripod for about a month or two now and barely got to use it. I brought it with me to Italy and just wanted something small, lightweight easy to have in my backpack. Just used it for 30 second long exposure and the pictures are amazing. They make the restaurant view better then the actual thing. For being so small it is really sturdy. I was using a Sony A7rii with a canon 70-200 f4 totally worth the $20. Go check out my Instagram for photos at rigoberto_q
customer_reviews.author: Rigoberto

customer_reviews.title: Not for really big heads...
customer_reviews.text: I can't say anything bad about this helmet. It seems high quality and is surprisingly light. But if you have a big head the large size isn't going to cut it. I measured my head tonight... 25.5 inch diameter. This helmet isn't nearly big enough. I looked like a doofus and it just doesn't feel or look right sitting on my head. Look elsewhere big headed people...
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Vosburgh

customer_reviews.title: Quality and functionality in a small package!
customer_reviews.text: I just received it, easy to unpack and understand the functionality. Ball head adjusts easily and locks function as they should. I have my Fuji xt20 on it with a 35mm and it could definitely handle more weight as it should. Perfect size tripod for upcoming trip to Seattle when you want to limit bulk. I love that the legs adjust individually for challenging shots. I give 5 stars unless I stumble across any issues I will be sure to update my review. **I even registered it for an extra 5 year warranty free of charge, you can't go wrong. I have the Manfrotto befree and love the quality.
customer_reviews.author: vsnurse

customer_reviews.title: Solid and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I use two of these to hold flat led backfill lights for video conferencing. The lights are over a pound each. The tripods are rated to hold 2 lbs. They are very sturdy and the ball head stays in the place and position you set it. I think this is an excellent compact tripod that should easily perform well up to it's rated weight capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Pacific

customer_reviews.title: This makes vlogging so much easier!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! It's great as a tripod (though pretty short, as described) but it's especially helpful for vlogging because it's a lot easier to hold than the camera and you don't have to worry about accidentally covering the microphone or anything. You do have to totally unscrew it in order to get to the battery or SD card but that's no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: It's functional
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It's light-weight, thus easy to carry around. It's steady enough for a mirror-less camera: I used it for a Sony a6000--it works fine even with a 55-210 mm zoom lens on. Cons: The material and workmanship are acceptable but not great. The ball head adjustment is not smooth. In short: The tripod is functional: It can be very useful if you can find something to place it on but otherwise you can only shoot from a very low angle. Consider its price, it is not a bad choice.
customer_reviews.author: Kent92

customer_reviews.title: The One you have been looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Simply sturdy construction. I was at first worried if this was stout enough to support my Panasonic G9 with a lens, but those fears were allayed after receiving the Manfrotto, it's Rock Solid. and the price was right. Tell him what he's won Bob? Well, It's a Sturdy Manfrotto Tripod, just as described by the above reviewer.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Gravatt

customer_reviews.title: Great with one big issue
customer_reviews.text: This is a great table top tripod with one big issue. The non-slip feet have all fallen off and it is no longer a non-slip device. I really hate that a simple matter of glue makes me rate this at 2 stars
customer_reviews.author: TheBasicPilot

customer_reviews.title: Love this tripod for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to take to Iceland to use with my DSLR camera. It worked great the whole trip I loved it. It is compact, pretty lightweight, and sturdy. Unfortunately I lost it and had to buy a new one and when the new one came the button to swivel the camera was not tight so when I put my big heavy camera on it, it would not stay upright. I just returned it and got another one and the new one was fine. I also bought the phone attachment and that works good too.
customer_reviews.author: L Block

customer_reviews.title: Solid mini tripod
customer_reviews.text: Clever design and well executed. The legs fold together to make a hand grip, and the extendable legs provide a wide base for larger camera or lenses. Because it is plastic, there is slight flex but minimal. Ball moves freely when unlocked and is very solid when it is locked down. Camera mounting screw is free to rotate without rotating the entire tripod as with some mini tripods. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Sturdy and stable ball head
customer_reviews.text: Got this after the ball head of my Ubeesize (same price, $21 ish) keeps loosening. The simple and matte design makes this tripod looks 10 times more expensive. You can’t alter the height but I can stack books beneath. Very compact and light. Holds my canon g7x 2 + a tascam + a shotgun mic + flash bracket easily (altogether these are about 1.6lb) and it is SO STURDY. Should have gone with Manfrotto from the first place. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: A must have for travel!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife for a trip and she did not drop it the entire trip , she loved it so mush that she actually started Vlogging due to how comfortable she felt walking around with this device holding her camera. It's small enough to toss in a hand bag, store in a water pocket of a backpack and hang on to all day walking.
customer_reviews.author: Jovan

customer_reviews.title: Good but limiting
customer_reviews.text: This tripod is great, but limiting. You can only have the legs go out to one position, which can be an issue when trying to mount on a narrow surface. I like the ball head, just wish it could go 90 degrees. I really don’t think you can beat this for the price (why I gave it 4 stars), however I ended up buying a more functional Lefoto mini tripod which I am in love with, but it did cost a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely terrible
customer_reviews.text: I dont think I've ever been so quick to write a review. I also very rarely leave bad reviews. I bought this tripod to start vlogging and taking pictures on my vacation. The button to move the ball joint is hard to press and the product is absolutely HORRIBLE. Theres like black residue on the silver ball and it looks like it started to rust or something before I got it. I cant use it and I absolutely hate it. Thanks, now I have to spend money to buy something else because this is useless.....
customer_reviews.author: Jen Hyacinthe

customer_reviews.title: Broke on my 3rd use - not recommended
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tripod because it had the name Manfrotto - a well respected brand that I have used before. I literally used this tripod three times and the third time the plastic that holds the leg in place broke and the leg fell out. It was never dropped. It stayed in my bedroom until I used it to photograph my motorcycle. I contacted the manufacturer through the support website and never received a response. I would NOT RECOMMEND this product.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis A Tarwater

customer_reviews.title: Compact, Fun to Use and Solid Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: What a great purchase. It feels solid and well built. The grip is great for my hand and I love the sound when the three legs come together so I can use it for vlogging or run and gun broll video. product_meta.title: Manfrotto PIXI Mini Tripod, Black (MTPIXI-B)
product_meta.description: Size:Tripod Only| Style:Black TripodThe Manfrotto PIXI is the perfect mini tripod for Compact System Cameras (CSC). It has been designed to satisfy the needs of those consumers that are looking for a support that is lightweight, portable and easy to use. The PIXI is great for achieving hard to get video shots while keeping your camera steady. Close the legs to use it as a comfortable grip to capture great videos that stand out from the crowd. The new push-button mechanism enables you to position and lock the ball head in one rapid, intuitive movement. Pushing the button releases the ball joint to move freely. When the button is released, the ball is locked automatically in the selected position. PIXI has a minimal Italian style and is manufactured from stainless steel and Adaptor for high quality and a tactile finish. With this solid construction, it provides a secure base in every situation and the rubber feet guarantee a stable and slip-free purchase on any surface. DSLR Compatibility Thanks to the universal 1/4" screw thread and the excellent stability, PIXI can be used with a huge variety of digital devices; the iPhone (with KLYP), compact cameras, CSC's and even entry level DSLR's. PIXI has been developed for entry level DSLRs fitting these basic requirements: Body: maximum weight of 650g/1.4lbs Focal length: maximum 85mm (standard non professional lens) Total equipment payload: maximum 1kg/2.2lbs. Please consider that any semi-professional and professional equipment exceeds these requirements. SPECIFICATIONS: Attachment (Top) 1/4" screw attachment type Color black color Front Tilt -35° / +35° tilt range Material Adaptor + stainless steel Panoramic Rotation 360 degrees. Closed Length 7.28 in Load Capacity 2.2 lbs . Features maximum working temperature of around 60 degree celsius and with a minimum working temperature of -30 degree celsius
